titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Mildred Fairchild Woodbury received her master's degree from Oberlin in 1925. She received a doctorate from Bryn Mawr College in 1929. Woodbury served as a faculty member in the Department of Social Economy and Social Research from 1930-1947. and was director from 1936 to 1947. She was active in a number of outside groups and organizations, including; the YWCA of Philadelphia. the Public Advisory Committee for the State of Pennsylvania; and the Health and Welfare Council.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the professional and personal papers of Mildred Fairchild Woodbury. Materials include: histories and administrative records for the Department of Social Work and Social Research at Bryn Mawr College; correspondence, reports, meeting minutes, notes and newsletters and printed materials related to Woodbury's work with the American Association of University Women Philadelphia Branch, the YWCA, the Pennsylvania Advisory Committee for Public Assistance, and the Southeast Regional Planning Council. There are also grant applications to the Pennsylvania Criminal Justice Planning Board. Also included are a small number of personal letters sent to Woodbury by her husband in 1951-1952.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Bryn Mawr College: Bryn Mawr College Graduate School of Social Work and Social Research records
